item.title: Algebra Is for Those Without Algorithms
item.description: This new entry explores how to use genetic algorithms to solve electronic circuits for hobbyist applications

item.title: The Ubiquitous Dot Product
item.description: This new entry explores the ubiquity of the dot product in statistical methods including variance and covariance

item.title: R Parallelization through Batch Processing
item.description: This new entry explores how to parallelize tasks from within R using a batch processing software like TORQUE

item.title: Reeling in Fisher's Z Transformation
item.description: This new entry explores the Fisher z-transformation, demonstrating it empirically using the R programming language

item.title: Genetic Monkeys on Typewriters
item.description: This new entry explores the efficacy of genetic algorithms and their implementation in the R programming language
